questions.text: Best diagnostic test for best disease is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Electrooculography Best disease Disease type: Vitelliform macular dystrophy that cause progressive vision loss Underlying cause: Genetic affection of cells in macula leading to loss of central vision

Highyeild:

Tests of diagnosis: Electrooculogram: Reduced light (peak): dark (trough) ratio Electroretinogram: Usually turns out normal in best disease Optical coherence tomography: Depends on stage of best disease

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A. Electroretinography Option C. USG Option D. Fluorescence angiography In question Best diagnostic test for best disease is asked so option B is correct.

Extraedge:

The electroocoulogram (EOG) is an elecrophysiologic test that measures the existing resting electrical potential between the cornea and Bruch's membrane. The mean transepithelial voltage of bovine Retinal pigment epithelium is 6 millivolts (mV).

questions.text: For radiotherapy, an isotope is placed in or around cancer site. It is called as:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Brachytherapy Brachytherapy refers to a treatment in which a radioisotope is placed onto or inside the volume to be treated.

Highyeild:

One of the key features of brachytherapy is that the irradiation affects only a very localised area around the radiation sources because dose falls off rapidly, obeying the inverse square law. As long as the sources are placed precisely within the tumour, there is minimal exposure to radiation of healthy tissues further away from the sources. This allows very high doses to be administered to the target volume.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option B. Teletherapy is the use of radioactive material, such as 60Co , for production of an external beam of gamma rays for treatment at a distance from the radioactive source Option C. External beam radiotherapy constitutes the mainstay of radiation treatment. It uses a radiation beam that originates at a distance from the patient and is directed towards a defined treatment volume. Approximately 85% of all therapeutic radiation exposures are delivered using external beam techniques. Various types and energies of radiation can be delivered in this way, including electromagnetic radiation such as x-rays and γ-rays, or particles such as electrons and protons. Higher energies of radiation penetrate deeper into body tissues. Option D. Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT) is an advanced type of radiation therapy used to treat cancer and noncancerous tumors. IMRT uses advanced technology to manipulate photon and proton beams of radiation to conform to the shape of a tumor.

Extraedge:

Brachytherapy allows targeting a smaller area than external radiation therapy, which directs high-energy x-rays from outside the body. The main benefit of brachytherapy is the ability to destroy cancerous cells in a more efficient way while minimizing the side effects for the patient.

questions.text: Which is the treatment of choice for irradiation in Chordoma?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Protons Chordoma: Slow-growing neoplasm Arising from cellular remnants of notochord. Arise from bone in skull base and along spinal cord. Most common locations - Cranially at clivus In sacrum at bottom of spine

Highyeild:

Radiation therapy: Are relatively radioresistant High doses of radiation required to control. Hence, high focus radiation like proton therapy and carbon ion therapy are preferred than Conventional radiation methods. Close proximity to vital structures like brain stem, requires high precision and accuracy for any planned surgical resection. Radiation with high accuracy and minimal damage with maximal safety is delivered.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option B. electrons: These are produced in the linear accelerator . The target, which produces x-rays when bombarded with electrons, is removed so that a beam of high-energy electrons is produced instead. Option C. A treatment using gamma rays, a type of high-energy radiation that can be tightly focused on small tumors or other lesions in the head or neck , so very little normal tissue receives radiation. Option D. Three-Dimensional Conformal Radiotherapy: The incorporation of axial imaging data allows 3D reconstruction of the tumour and surrounding organs. This provides more accurate localisation of the target volume and more information regarding the amount of normal tissue that will be irradiated.

Extraedge:

Chordoma is a slow growing cancer of tissue found inside the spine. Chordoma can happen anywhere along the spine. It is most often found near the tailbone (called a sacral tumor) or where the spine meets the skull (called a clival tumor). Chordoma is also called notochordal sarcoma.

questions.text: Radiation exposure during infancy has been linked to which of the following carcinomas:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Thyroid Common examples of radiation-induced malignancies. Initial cancer Radiation-induced malignancies Low-grade glioma Meningioma, sarcoma Retinoblastoma Osteosarcoma Nasopharyngeal carcinoma Oral cavity, particularly tongue Breast cancer Esophageal cancer, angiosarcoma Prostate cancer Bladder, rectal cancer Ewing's sarcoma Osteosarcoma Hodgkin lymphoma Thyroid, breast, stomach cancer

Highyeild:

Thyroid cancer is a growth of cells that starts in the thyroid. The thyroid is a butterfly-shaped gland located at the base of the neck, just below the Adam's apple. The thyroid produces hormones that regulate heart rate, blood pressure, body temperature and weight. Thyroid cancer might not cause any symptoms at first

Extraedge:

There are 5 main types of thyroid cancer: Papillary thyroid cancer. Papillary thyroid cancer develops from follicular cells and usually grow slowly. ... Follicular thyroid cancer. ... Hurthle cell cancer. ... Medullary thyroid cancer (MTC). ... Anaplastic thyroid cancer.

questions.text: The technique employed in radiotherapy to counteract the effect of tumor motion due to breathing is known as:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Gating Respiratory gating is a breathing technique used during external radiation therapy. It uses a device that monitors your breathing and adjusts the radiation beam as needed during treatment . External radiation therapy uses a precise beam of radiation, aimed into the body to damage cancer cells.
